title: BBC Local Live: Northamptonshire on Monday 29 June 2015 - BBC News
summary: tunisia beach attack : irchester man tells how he and his family 'ran for their lives ' .
comments that f1 is dull should not worry the industry in the county .
one 's crimewatch roadshow comes from northamptonshire today .

documents.title: goodbye
text: that 's all for today from the first ever bbc local live page for northamptonshire .
i 'll be back tomorrow from 08:00 with all the news , weather , sport and travel from across the county .
enjoy the evening sunshine - while it lasts
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tunisia beach attacks : holidays cancelled
text: there are still many people who have holidays booked for tunisia , but following the
managing director of baileys travel in wellingborough , chris bailey , told me : `` some have chosen to cancel , some are rebooking for other places .
do n't just rely on the foreign office advice , speak to who you booked the holiday with . ''
author: Neil Bradford
BBC Look East

text: a salesman from kettering could be jailed for failing to reveal all he knows about his missing nephew , six-year-old
mohammed chaudhry was today remanded in custody by a high court judge investigating the disappearance .

remaining dry overnight with a low of 15c ( 59f ) , but 13c ( 55f ) in rural areas .

documents.title: tunisia beach attack : 'relief to be out '
text: earlier we heard from graeme scott from irchester , who
he was there with his parents , and his cousin karl .
i 've been to meet the family for
graeme 's father sid , 72 , said : `` it 's a relief to be out of the trouble , it was a relief to walk down the street to get a paper .
it was panic really , we could hardly run , but we got through it . ''

documents.title: wellingborough a 'cinderella ' town
text: i 've been to see the stanton cross development in wellingborough .
compulsory purchase could be used to secure land ( for an access road into the development and there will be a new road bridge linking wellingborough station and the area .
wellingborough chamber of commerce president , david cross said : `` wellingborough has been waiting patiently for a very big development .
we 've been feeling a bit of 'cinderella ' town .
author: Stuart Ratcliffe
BBC Look East

the woman had been drinking by the lake with a man .
they had two dogs with them .
the man then turned on her and assaulted her , causing facial injuries .
the offender is described as white with a stocky build , in his early forties .

documents.title: tunisia beach attack : 'i was completely numb '
text: i 've been speaking to karl scott from irchester who was in a nearby hotel during the
he said : `` there were 30 people in the room i was in .
at the time i was just completely numb , i did n't know what was happening .
`` whether you live or die you just do n't know .
i 'm lucky to be here . ''
author: Mike Cartwright
BBC Look East

full commentary continues

documents.title: pupil funding gap
text: the council says northamptonshire is one of the lowest funded local authorities per pupil .
bosses say the current funding formula should be scrapped and a new national formula introduced to close the gap between the highest and lowest funded local authorities .

text: i 'm heading to wellingborough to speak to the leader of borough council of wellingborough , paul bell , about compulsory purchase powers for the £ 500m stanton cross development .

documents.title: tunisia beach attack : 'why , why ? '
text: more from our interview with irchester tourist graeme scott , who survived the tunisian gun attack by taking refuge in a cellar at the imperial marharba hotel .
mr scott hid in the cellar with about 20 other holidaymakers until police came to their rescue .
he said : `` the thought in our heads was 'why , why ? '
why has someone done this ? ''
author: BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: crimewatch roadshow in the county

they 'll be looking at the work trained sniffer dogs do to detect cases of arson and how traffic officers teach young drivers about road safety .

documents.title: tunisia beach attack : 'i feel i 'm very lucky '
text: `` it will be quite a few years before i even think about going back to tunisia . ''
those were the thoughts of a `` relieved '' and `` lucky '' graeme scott on his return from tunisia , where he was staying at the hotel imperial marharba in sousse at the time of the gun attack .

mr scott , from irchester , who flew back into the uk on saturday night and is back at work this morning , said : `` we need to gather our thoughts ( tour operator ) thomson has offered us counselling and i think i 'm going to have to take up the offer . ''
author: BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: tunisia beach attack : 'adrenaline took over '
text: graeme scott , from irchester , told how he and his parents , aged 68 and 72 , ran for cover to the cellar of the imperial marharba hotel .
he told bbc radio northampton : `` my mum has had a double knee replacement , but she just ran , adrenaline took over . ''
author: BBC Radio Northampton

the latest reports suggest at least 30 of the 38 victims are british .
mr scott said : `` it was the sheer presence of police .
there were two or three bodies with towels over them . ''

mr scott , who was with his parents and cousin , said the family initially thought the sound of gun shots were `` fire crackers '' .

documents.title: good morning
text: welcome to the first ever bbc local live page for northamptonshire , and what a beautiful day for it .
between now and 18:00 we 'll be bringing you the latest news , weather , travel and sport for northamptonshire from the bbc newsroom in northampton .
if you want to get in touch
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live
